commenter_a: The reason we spend the most with the worst outcomes is because we save people who wouldn't have ever had a chance elsewhere in the world. Our 911 system is a model for the global community and have a lots of saves who would've died elsewhere. The people that we save and live often go on to live on ventilators and long term care. Ever been to sub-acute hospital? That's where all $ to outcome ratio goes out the window. Are you going to be the one to tell someone you're pulling the plug on their ventilator because they are costing too much?
